page.title: 01BRABOURNE-A GENERAL VIEW.
page.content: Brabourne is situated approximately seven miles to the east of Ashford in the county of Kent.The village is to be found in pleasant countryside at the foot of the North Downs. Many people like to stroll along the North Downs Way overlooking the village taking in the view stretching beyond Ashford to the west,over Romney Marsh,and on to Dungeness in the south. The area is given over mainly to farmland,there being very few amenities here.Within the village is the church of St.Mary's,a kilometre or so to the west,down a short lane is the primary school,whilst further to the west at Bircholt Forstal is the village hall which also serves the nearby villages of Brabourne Lees and Smeeth.
